subject: Re: [junit] Test Results with Exception Handling
msgSnippet: [Apologies for the HTML tags. Yahoo mail s fault.] I suggest you read http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?JavaUnitBestPractices, from which you ll find an article on this
messageBody:
[Apologies for the HTML tags. Yahoo mail's fault.]

I suggest you read
http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?JavaUnitBestPractices, from
which you'll find an article on this subject. Enjoy.

JBR.

--- Bill Christian <getuuid@...> wrote:

<HR>
<html><body>


<tt>
I've read the current Best Practices and search the
group archives for <BR>
related articles but I am still confused. I would
appreciate your <BR>
indulgence.<BR>
<BR>
Should a test case return a success or failure on a
method when it throws an <BR>
exception. Specifically, I have a method that loads
environment variables <BR>
from a source file. If the file is not found, the
method throws a <BR>
FileNotFoundException. Now the test case has a
try/catch block to trap the <BR>
exception but should I fail the test if caught.<BR>
<BR>
Currently, my thinking is the test case passes because
the method did in <BR>
fact function correctly. The code is written to throw
an error. However, <BR>
reading the articles on the subject I am confused.
Should the test case <BR>
re-throw the exception? Report a failure? Report a
success but output a <BR>
message the test case was inconclusive?<BR>
<BR>
Thanks.<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
_________________________________________________________________<BR>
Get your FREE download of MSN Explorer at <a
href="http://explorer.msn.com/intl.asp.">http://explorer.msn.com/intl.asp.</a><BR>
<BR>
</tt>

<br>
